page.title: 09FARMING IN FENNY COMPTON.
page.content: There are six farmers in the grid area, each of whom was interviewed by the children.Of Mr. Harry Lambert, they wrote as follows:His house was built in 1220, and was extended in 1667.He farms 190 acres,100 acres are used for wheat and barley, 60 acre4s for pasture,and 30 acres are share.He owns 400 LonsdaleLarge White pigs,mostly for eating.His sheep are a crossbreed called Mule, a Leicester crossed with Wensleydale.The lambs are for meat.Each year, he has 300tons of grain, & 90 tons of barley. He owns 3 tractors,a bailer,a combine,several ploughs,a combine,a sprayer,harrows, a Land Rover and 5 trailers.He employs one farmworker, & has one sheepdog.The other farms follow much the same pattern -Grange Farm has an area of 450.25 acres,& is owned by an Oxford College.Rectory Farm has 206 acres.
